newsitem.title: NORWAY: Cash-rich Oslo bourse sneaks to new all-time high.
newsitem.headline: Cash-rich Oslo bourse sneaks to new all-time high.

text.p: Norwegian shares ticked slightly higher on Wednesday to set a new all-time high close and traders said sentiment remained positive with plenty of cash entering the market.

Oslo's Total share index sneaked up 0.03 points to 1,015.39 points in turnover of 1.40 billion crowns. It set a new record intraday high in early trade at 1,023.41 points before drifting lower with some selling seen in the blue chips.
"The biggest movers have been the small companies. Investors are looking for small to medium caps with possible earnings potential," said one broker.
"The market is very liquid, people are screaming to find new investment opportunities."
Brokers said some selling was seen in specific blue chips, notably food-based conglomerate Orkla, oil company Saga Petroleum and metals producer Elkem.
Saga took a 4.50 crown dip to close at 121.50 crowns following news of a dry exploration well in the North Sea Ekofisk area.
Dealers said Elkem continued to be pressured downwards by the strong rally in the crown. The share finished 1.50 crowns off at 104.50 crowns.
